docs.text: capsule : the much anticipated re-adaptation of the pierre boulle novel comes to the screen as a dark and a little dreary film with lots of chases and fighting , but very little intelligence .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: visually there is much to like about this version , but the approach is to take an adventure after the style of gulliver's travels and treat it as an action film .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: that makes it a film without much center .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: pierre boulle , author of the bridge on the river kwai , wrote planet of the apes ( a . k . a . monkey planet ) , the novel , as a social satire .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: it reads a lot like a fifth book of gulliver's travels .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: humans discover a planet in which the roles of apes and humans have been reversed , not unlike the roles of horses and humans on jonathan swift's island of the houyhnhnms .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the novel moves somewhat slowly to create some suspense in revealing all the things most film fans know to be true about the nature of the planet .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: it seems to me there is also a statement about human cruelty to animals , but perhaps i was just looking for that .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: when rod serling adapted the novel into a film released in 1968 , he added a number of serling touches , familiar from episodes of the twilight zone and changed the ending to make it more serling-ish .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the final irony of the original version has become film history .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: without it there could never have been a " planet of the apes " film series .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: i can surmise only that serling ran into serious script problems in how to handle the tricky question of language .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: in the book the apes had their own language and the human eventually learned that language .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: that could have been done in the film , but that would have required the entire film to be subtitled for the non-ape-speaking .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: serling avoided this by having the apes speak english and , of course , there is some justification for that by the end of the film .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: justifying why the apes spoke english may have even been the inspiration for his surprise ending .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: but serling never tackles the all-important question of why a supposedly intelligent human never shows any curiosity or even surprise that the apes speak his own language , a language they had no opportunity to ever hear .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: few viewers questioned this serious plot hole , however , and the film has become well respected in cinema history .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: partial credit at least should go to jerry goldsmith whose extremely inventive score is one of goldsmith's best if not his best .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: when the film's success called for sequels , the filmmakers turned up the violence and they added well-intentioned , though not very subtle , political messages about what was happening in the united states of the 1960s and 1970s .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: while the first film had a little shooting of guns and what was there seemed a little half- hearted , by the second film , beneath the planet of the apes , there was a good deal more violence and from that point on the series had a lot of violence and chases .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the series concluded with battle for the planet of the apes in 1973 .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: now director tim burton tries his hand at adapting the original book again .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: for those who thought that the 1968 version was not very faithful to the book , burton's new version is even less faithful .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: first , he does not really reverse the roles of the humans and the apes .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: he has them both be intelligent , articulate races battling for a dominance of the planet currently in the hands , uh , make that paws , of the apes .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: that could be a good story too , but it is not planet of the apes .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: as with the mission impossible films and so many other cinematic homages to the third quarter of the last century , the title makes promises that the filmmakers have no intention of honoring .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: in 2029 leo davidson ( mark wahlberg , not this world's most expressive actor ) works on a space station increasing the intelligence and usefulness of apes .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: then a convenient time storm sweeps him up wizard-of-oz-fashion and drops him on an alien planet .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: ( yes , he survives this storm , but then no storm is perfect . )
docs.label: negative

docs.text: he quickly finds , not greatly to any surprise he shows , that on this planet apes rule and humans drool , but everybody talks .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: and the language they talk is earth- english .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: apparently it does not even occur to leo that there is a mystery that needs to be explained about that .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the fact it does not occur to leo and apparently didn't occur to tim burton either is the heart of the real horror of this film .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: both just assumed that if apes were going to talk the language they would speak would be english .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: in any case having one talking race dominating another makes this not a look at human-animal relationships and more one of the master-slave relationships .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: outside of sudan and a few other countries this is a less relevant topic .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: leo is captured to be used as a slave but also is discovered by ari , played by helena bonham carter .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: ari is an attractive ape with close ties to high political power .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: she is bent on making the world a better place .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: perhaps in a previous draft of the script she was called hil-ari .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: in any case with makeup that stifles her usual pout , carter is just about as attractive as she has ever been in a film .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: she may want to consider this to become her standard look from this point forward .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: it is not long before leo escapes with some human and only a couple of sympathetic apes .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: this is a further abandonment of the source material .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the chase severely limits the interplay of ape and human and the examination of each's place in this reversed society , each important in the book .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: we cannot see how the society works because most of the screentime society has broken down .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: we see the humans either separated from the apes or fighting them .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: burton chooses visceral thrills over cerebral ones at almost every turn .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: this is a miscalculation , as characters so lacking in empathy value are difficult ones to place much emotional investment in .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: they are basically chess pieces and the viewer has little reason to root for them to win .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the 1968 script had little subtlety , with lines like " i never met an ape i didn't like , " but at least we cared for what happened to taylor , the main character .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: most of what this film has to offer is in the visuals .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the visual work is spotty but generally nicely done except that so much of the film takes place in the night or in fog .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: this tends to limit close looks at the makeup .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: in general it seems much improved from 1968 .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the makeup team is led by rick baker instead of john chambers , who did it for the 1968 version .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: in 1968 chambers makeup was a jaw-dropper .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: it was realistic enough to almost be believable but flexible enough to show emotion .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: chambers is good , but if anyone had a chance to best him it would have to be baker .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: today audiences have higher expectations ; baker's visualization is really an improvement .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: these visuals work nicely .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: what does not work is the wire- assisted leaps some of the apes make .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: they look like they were inspired by the physics- defying leaps of crouching tiger , hidden dragon .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: apes spring incredible distances .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: some of the best scenes are apes running into battle looking like they have ape posture , but when they start flying through the air the effect is lost .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: one final visual problem is that the film frequently shows its budget in what should be spectacular battle scenes the camera shows us only a small group of people close-up .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: since the days of lon chaney and boris karloff few actors have crossed over to stardom in a role that required heavy make-up .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the one actor who has a shot is paul giamatti .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: it is not that his lines are so good , most are silly jokes .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: but he delivers them very well .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: he was always a watchable actor , but has not yet made stardom .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: as the ape-trader limbo he over-emotes to overcome his ape make-up , but does it very well .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: in doing so he makes himself the most interesting thing on the screen .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: he is probably the best thing in the film and conjures up memories of peter ustinov's performance in spartacus .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: as an in-joke there are several lines in the script borrowed from the 1968 film and an old ape played by charleton heston becomes an allusion to the first film by itself .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: danny elfman's score has a nice primitive feel , but jerry goldsmith's 1968 tour de force score is a real classic .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: that score and the whole film will be remembered when the 2001 film is forgotten .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: i rate the remake 4 on the 0 to 10 scale and a 0 on the -4 to +4 scale .
docs.label: negative
